alert.note: Alert for Middle Kuskokwim Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued June 10 at 7:56AM AKDT until June 10 at 10:00PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 10 PM AKDT THIS EVENING FOR HOT DRY AND WINDY CONDITIONS FOR THE MIDDLE KUSKOKWIM VALLEY FROM THE KUSKOKWIM RIVER NORTH... * Winds...North 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 25 mph. Highest winds across the higher terrain. * Timing...Hot, dry, and windy conditions are expected to begin around noon and continue through 10 pm this evening. * Relative Humidity...As low as 15 percent. * Temperatures...72 to 76 degrees. * Location...Middle Kuskokwim Valley from the Kuskokwim River north. This includes areas north of Aniak, Chuathbaluk, Crooked Creek, Red Devil, Sleetmute and Stony River. * Impacts...Rapid ignition, growth and spread of fires will be possible.
info.instruction: A red flag warning means that critical fire weather conditions are imminent or occurring now, or will shortly. It is directed toward fire agencies, and through them to the public.
